Reviews.Title: “To be avoided”
Reviews.Author: kjc88
Reviews.Content: Me and boyfriend stayed for one night at SO Paddington. I chose it for the location and for it's cheapness. I suppose the price should have been an indication of the quality to be expected. The staff were pleasant enough though, so no complaints there. We were situated in a double room on the top floor. The ceiling, curtains and walls had dirty marks. The bed was awful, very hard with springs that must have been broken. In the bathroom the cold water tap ran warm. The worst came in the morning when we were awoken from the sound of what would seem to be all the water pipes in the building running through our bathroom. The noise went on for quite a while as obviously other guests were using the showers in their rooms. Needless to say we made sure we made a swift exit after that. I wanted a cheap place to stay but I'll be looking elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “RAT in ROOM”
Reviews.Author: abdul k
Reviews.Content: Okay, where shall i begin with this horrendous hotel.... First of all shower was disfunctional and actually burnt us, second of all wait for it... there was a frikkin RAT in the room.. its funny because the night before we heard some noise from around our bed but as the light was switched of we didnt know what it was and were too tired to check, but the next day whilst lying in bed we saw a tail from behind one of the bags, and needless to say my girlfriend shrieked once she saw what was lurking behind the bag.. absolutely disgusting hotel.. and lets not forget to mention the daunting task of climbing the stairs to your room only to find that it is nothing like what is advertised, it was small a tedious to get around.. BTW there is no bath only a shower (which doesnt work properly)... anyone who is willing to stay at this hotel must be absolutely insane.. i have since had my head checked and hopefully would not make the same mistake again of wasting my money. there is no way this hotel deserves 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “MUCH better than expected after reading some of the reviews”
Reviews.Author: tar25zebra
Reviews.Content: I truly believe this hotel has received some unfair feedback. We got a great deal on this prime location hotel by using the Trivargo website but our main priority was a hotel in a great location with a clean and quiet room (which is exactly what we got!). This hotel is 2 minutes away from Paddington tube station and around the corner from lots of pubs and restaurants. All of the staff are friendly and we got lots of smiles and hello's from people that work here. A special mention must go to Francis and Lucica who worked on the reception desk. I think Francis is a duty manager. Both these members of staff were very helpful, friendly and professional in there approach. It was my partners birthday and I put this in the booking and both members of staff wished him happy birthday. Needless to say, the little fuss put a smile on my partners face! When booking the room I asked for a quiet room and we were even given a choice of viewing 2 rooms to choose from. This was very unexpected and very welcome. We chose room 404 and had a good nights sleep which when considering the location was surprising. The hotel could definitely do with a refurb as I think it has a lot of potential. It's location and staff are it's strong points. There is no lift here but that was not a problem as I was expecting that from reading tripadvisor. To conclude - this hotel is clearly not The Ritz but if you are looking for a clean and reasonably priced BASE to explore London then look no further. We will certainly be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Lizzyg63
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews on trip advisor I was expecting the worst. However I was pleasantly surprised. Myself and my husband stayed in a double room which was small and basic, but clean. The reception staff were welcoming and the location was fantastic - two minutes from tube station, plenty of places to eat and good pubs. Perfect base for a couple of nights at a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Richard S
Reviews.Content: Ideal hotel if you are on a budget. Room was clean with free coffee provided. Staff were very friendly, and did their best to help. I booked as a solo traveller, and the room had a double bed, so it was fine size wise for me. If there had been two sharing the room, it would be cramped. Would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Do not believe your eyes watching pictures of this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: bogdanovaolga
Reviews.Content: The hotel is marked as 3 stars hotel on Booking.com (which I always use to book hotels, which I trust, appreciate and love). But this time... We were booking the hotel last minute and the choice was very limited for this location. I've understand that I'm choosing very simple hotel, didnt have any expectations at all, and trusted that pictures are true. But when arrived to the hotel - I couldnt believe my eyes! we were given 2 rooms - one on the -1 floor and the second one on the 4th floor. Both just horrible. Cold, frayed, seedy.... the shower cabin is so tiny you cant move and so old you cant step inside barefooted. Linoleum on the floor. Smell of coldness and oldness. The hotel itself does not put any 3stars on its doors - which is fare - there should not be any. We booked standard double rooms and on the pictures they have looked very simple but not terrible. Maybe all rooms of the hotel are beautiful except those two we were provided... but I do not think so. The only advantage at the end was free WiFi... which came out not to work well either on -1 or 4 floor...

Reviews.Title: “simple and efficient”
Reviews.Author: tom k
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, Francis was really helpful and friendly I'll definitely be recommending this to friends and associates.

Reviews.Title: “Great for my Business”
Reviews.Author: Neil C
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this Hotel since August 2011. They have always been very accomodating. The hotel is the perfect base for my business in London. I see no reason to change.

Reviews.Title: “So so Paddington”
Reviews.Author: Mikey1664
Reviews.Content: Positives to start with - lovely receptionist on the lunchtime shift and hotel location very convenient for Paddington. Price of Â£60 for room was fair for location. Basement room was OK - room was under the stairs - although nowhere to hang clothes bar improvisation using the light fittings. Evening receptionist was an indian fellow who arranged a taxi from a 'friend' for us to Leicester Square for Â£20 after we negotiated him down from Â£23. Said taxi did not materialise in sufficient time so we took a black cab which ran to Â£11 (yes - notice the difference). Be warned. Bed was OK but you could feel and hear the springs (cheap bed rather than old, methinks). Room was quiet barring odd tube train rumble but lets be reasonable about that. Continental breakfast not start well when the breakfast girl did not turn up (probably used the invisible taxi firm) but she appeared in the nick of time and was a delightful young lady with a genuine smile so she was readily forgiven. In summary - fair price for an overnighter in good location for Paddington. Staff good barring the dodgy taxi service.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: wklos
Reviews.Content: Booked rooms on late rooms.com. Photos are nothing like the place. We were given a room on the 4th floor, no lift and steep steps and each floor, ladders and ironong boards left on landings. The room was shabby, small, no towels until we complained. The window would not stay open and generally not fit for purpose.The bathroom was tiny, you could not move in the shower, if you did, you switched the water off, which was probably a good thing, as if you stayed in for more than 3 minutes, the shower tray overflowed. We paid for "continental breakfast" - on offer, cornflakes and toast - terrible. Could not wait to get out of the place. A complete waste of money

Reviews.Title: “check room out before you stay”
Reviews.Author: Anne T
Reviews.Content: seeemed pleasant from booking site. staff pleasant. breakfast adequate. The room was in the basement and very hot despite window being open; tv reception was intermittant but put that down to being in the basement. There was a damp smell as if a hot water tank had overflowed complained and was told it would be seen too; they did sort out light bulbs. The smell was still evident later that day so complained again when left hotel in the morning also told them that would not recommend them to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A small 'hostal' in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: luuuuuu
Reviews.Content: The truth is the room is small, specialy the tiny shower. The 'hotel' looks more like a hostel, but lets be honest, breakfast + two blocks form one of the most important and 'center located' stations + a room for two for less than 80 pounds its a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine”
Reviews.Author: PyynikinParoni
Reviews.Content: I was expecting something totally horrible, but the hotel was really quite ok! Yes, the room was very small and the lay out of the room plain dumb. Shower booth was incredibly small just as warned here. But otherwise everything was fine! Extremely friendly and helpful staff, super location, clean toilet and loads of pillows on the bed. Bed wasn't the best because you could feel the springs, but i've had far worse and still i would say the sleep quality was good enough. Price was really inexpensive so this hotel was a great choice for me. I actually will consider staying there again if I get a good quite again!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this!”
Reviews.Author: carlo g
Reviews.Content: Micro room, underground, scaring. A cantina rather than a room!

Reviews.Title: “DON'T stay in this place”
Reviews.Author: Deeleacy
Reviews.Content: Advertised and priced as a hotel more like an overpriced hostel for a few extra pounds you could get somewhere so much nicer. Pictures completely misleading no wonder there is full charge for cancellation as it is sooo not worth the cost! Pictures completely misleading. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest rooms and shower unit in London”
Reviews.Author: etash
Reviews.Content: We had an overnight stay having been offered a reduction in price by Late Rooms from over Â£300 to Â£119. The room was tiny, just sufficient for a doub le bed. The bathroom had a shower unit that must be the smallest on the market (approximately 2ft by 2 ft.) The breakfast was a joke. A continental type breakfast of the worst kind. Avoid like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “Grim”
Reviews.Author: Jimmywolf
Reviews.Content: Awful place. Good location but that is all it has going for it. Room on the fourth floor and no lift. Room had a really revolting smell and no hot water in my shower. Avoid unless desperate.

Reviews.Title: “Prision cell!”
Reviews.Author: Wez9483
Reviews.Content: If this is what you call a room with an en suite, i would have hated to see their idea of a penthouse. Room size of prision cell, an old rickity cupboard in corner and thank god my partner didnt see the mouse trap in corner. Security is a concern, had to prop suit case against door to stop it opening. basically the less said the better about this SO called hotel. I have backpacked around europe and stay in some grotty places but this hotel is the worst by far!!!

Reviews.Title: “I've found out the real meaning of "tiny"”
Reviews.Author: daw83
Reviews.Content: Well...I was'n expecting any four stars hotel of course. But I couldn't imagine that the room was so small. We were at fourth floor (no elevator). Maybe the rooms on the other floors are bigger, but that was was very very very tiny. We didn't know where to put our luggage and there was just a bed (not a big one and little bit uncomfortable) a little night table and a small wardrobe. The bathroom wasn't in the room; well there was a shower and a sink, but we had to share the toilet bowl with other three rooms. Anyway in the end it wasn't so awful. After we got used with dwarf standard we realized that the hotel was in a great position (just few steps from paddington stop, Zone 1) and we could come back late at night easily with bus. The only thing annoyed me was to share the bathroom. I mean, there's nothing wrong with that I did it many times, but it wasn't clear in the reservation and the price we paid was too high for a room without a proper bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Awful!!”
Reviews.Author: ILoveSpongebob
Reviews.Content: Do not go to this hotel!! It's a rip off. Breakfast is terrible. One man on reception was very helpful. Room was tiny, really hot, door didn't lock properly and window didn't close either! Really dirty and run down hotel, watch out for the mouse traps! Felt like stepping back in time. Reminded me of a hostel. Overall it was not worth the Â£100! Not even a quarter of that! Location was really close to station and in a beautiful little area. Plenty of hotels nearby. AVOID AVOID ABOID this one!!

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AVOID...absolutely disgusting hotel!”
Reviews.Author: wozzatusis
Reviews.Content: We was booked to stay at the So Quartier in Kilburn high road but due to a flood they sent us to there other hotel the So Paddington...and we basically refused to sleep there, we viewed two rooms, both damp, smelly, dirty , no handels on the doors, brown springy matresses, broken furniture and as small as a shoe box, reminded me of a youth hostel I once worked in...absolutely disgusting !!

Reviews.Title: “oops big mistake”
Reviews.Author: allariundtheworld
Reviews.Content: saw on internet room was Â£400 last room Â£100 mmm sounds like a good deal. must be sauna, luxury room at least. Well no. It was not only a dump it was a 5 star dump room was nothing at all like the internet picture. 3 flights to room with 2 cases. got in room trouble locking. double bed flat screen TV very warm. no air con. very tight to move around. Thought I was only one in room. Maybe I was. The mouse trap near bed was empty or was it ?. floor dirty . shower not working unless you wanted really steaming hot. scalding shower. all in all. it needs to be closed and renovated at least to a doss house.standard. Amazing Health and Safety has never visited or have they ?

Reviews.Title: “WARNING!!! TERIIBLE CHEATERS!”
Reviews.Author: EmilToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: I was staying there for 1 night NEVER again! I was downgraded without warning or compensation to a MUCH smaller room on the top floor with no washroom. I specifically called before booked to make sure that hotel have full washrooms. When I tried to complain they said there was a problem with my room and there is nothing else they can do about it. Also they argue that my room had a washroom?! It shad a sink!!!, but where do they expect me to shâ€¦t? into the sink?

Reviews.Title: “TOTALLY AWFUL”
Reviews.Author: Sammy200584
Reviews.Content: I cant believe we didnt look at this website before....... This hotel is totally disgusting and awful. Its smells of sewage, the bathroom is a wardrobe, our shower was tempermental, the staff can barely speak our language, the breakfast consists of toast only and some manky orange juice and dont even get me started on the bed. Our wallets are Â£115 lighter for the pleasure of all that. GRIM GRIM GRIM. Frankly it needs closing!!!! Youve been warned..................

Reviews.Title: “Do not be decieved by the website.”
Reviews.Author: Platinum99
Reviews.Content: This is a 2 star hotel pretending to be something more. It is clean and tidy but not 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Stay well away from this dump”
Reviews.Author: ScottWindsor
Reviews.Content: Me and my freind were attending a sporting event in london so we chose this hotel because of its good location and price. Well lets just say we are both in the army and I would no have accepted this in the forces. There was a mouse trap in our room for a start, alarm bells ringing. We were put in the bacement where it was so hot and the window wouldnt open to start with. When we asked for a different room because of this and we had been given a double bed for me and my freind they declined. There was also a dead bug in the shower. Best advice for people is to spend that little bit extra for something better. So paddington, so bad

Reviews.Title: “Disaster”
Reviews.Author: jackiebartolo
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband went for a week and choose this hotel cause of its location...and reasonable price (not cheap).....I don need to write a long paragraph......Its just 1 fine day we saw a MOUSE in our room..........STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL....................

Reviews.Title: “It was OK.”
Reviews.Author: Leonidas_Dina
Reviews.Content: Great location, great breakfast, but very small rooms and not good quality of bed. But in the rows it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AT ALL COSTS”
Reviews.Author: streakey
Reviews.Content: We saw this hotel on a very trustworthy website that we have used many times.(booking.com) We were initially surprised at how cheap it was but we had been informed that the price was reasonable as it had recently changed owners and undergone a refurb so they needed to pick up business. The website showed lovely pictures and the description said all rooms had dvd player, tea and coffee making facilities, a desk and a hairdryer.Also said it had been refurbished. Well it has had a lick of paint here and there but that is about all. We were in room 614 and it was up many flights of narrow stairs. There was no working light at night to guide you up those stairs. The room was the smallest we have ever stayed in, but for one night we thought it would be ok. You could just about move around the edge of the bed if you touched the wall. The top bed cover was dirty but they did do pretty swan shapes for the two towels. The very tiny tv was hanging on a not very safe wall hanger. There was no DVD, No hairdryer and no tea and cofee facilities. They said they would put the tea and coffee facilities in the room and we trusted them but when we got home quite late the staff had changed. We found a tiny travel kettle that had not been tested for safety, two flimsy plastic cups that are meant only for cold drinks, some stolen sugars from Mcdonalds, two out of date coffee granule packets and worst of all two dirty possibly used teabags in an old used paper bowl. No milk and the night staff were not interested in helping us and said they never provide milk. The bedroom window had a huge broken piece of glass in it and we were scared it would fall on to us. The shower did fall on to us several times whilst we were showering as it was not secured to the wall. Don't get me wrong we were staying in a fully refurbished room as far as the staff were concerened and we could smell the fresh paint and see evidence of painting on the floor. Just a shabby and quick job was done though. For one night we managed but when we spoke to the hotel they were not interested in our concerns and to date they still have not addressed our complaint. We chose this room as a birthday surprise and it was ruined as it was such a bad experience. When we checked in we spoke to the reception man, a charming indian guy, who assured us that all the previous bad reviews had been addressed and that all would be fine for us, this was before he took our payment in full. We should have seen the room before we paid and we say to all readers of this, SEE ROOM FIRST DO NOT PAY THEN VIEW ROOM. It is posisble that they do have a couple of decent rooms that they keep for such people. We spoke to booking.com before we checked in and they said they had spoken to the hotel to check that all the facilities would be in the room. The hotel denied having this conversation and blamed booking.com for putting the wrong information on their website. Booking.com clearly say it is the hotel who is responsible for the information listed. We believe booking.com but that has not helped us as nobody is taking the blame. PLEASE BE CAREFUL THINGS ARE NOT WHAT THEY SEEM...... There are many other nice places in the same street for the same price or lower. Leave this hotel alone, they will rip you off. If you need more info or pictures please ask. I should add that I have travelled a lot all over the world and I always do reviews but this is the FIRST time I have had to write a negative review, so believe me this is really bad.

Reviews.Title: “So Paddington Hotel... so terrible experience!”
Reviews.Author: Joe82_Varese
Reviews.Content: Definitely the worst hotel I've ever been! I had to change my hotel after one night in this bad place for the first time in my life. It's manged by 2/3 guys who try to deceive the customers showing this structure as a renovated hotel but really it's a old, crumbling building with rusted stuff. They got us a room in the underground floor, close to the subway (!), very noisy, smelly and with a bathroom unwatchable! The bathroom is tiny, smaller than a van one and the fllush didn't work at all. No sign of hairdryer, DVD players, tea/coffee-making- There were no chairs or hooks and in front of the window there was an open space full of rubbish! The rain pipe was broken and during the rainy night seemed to be into the Niagara Falls. The reception doesn't exist (there is only a table with 2 chairs and one laptop) and there is only a sharing kitchen very dirty (no breakfast or other facilities). The only 2 pros are the location, near to the Paddigton station and the city center, and the kindness of one of the 2/3 people of the staff who understood our indignation. Absolutely not recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Scam !!!”
Reviews.Author: aspan
Reviews.Content: The hotel has changed its name on the net and it is called SO Paddington where in the front door (entrance) it has a sign Warwick !!! and the map is showing a different place Where do I start, ... by entering the hotel they ask for the full amount and they dont have a credit card machine. At least they accepted a 30% deposit and payed them in full at check out. On the booking site it clearly states breakfast available and there was none. We had to feed 4 kids and each morning we had o go looking for food. Luckily there was food across the street. The rooms were freshly painted and paint was sprayed everywhere. For 3 nights we had to sleep with open windows but still the smell was suffocating. At least there was sufficient heat (actually it was very hot) and there was hot water readily available. There was no elevator and we had to carry the suitcases on our backs 3 floors. The sheets at least were clean. One of the rooms had no internal bathroom but it was on the corridor !!! The carpet was dirty and on the stairs was loose with the danger of missing the step and falling a few flights of stairs. Luckily the location was excellent for catching all means of transportation. The guys are a scam and they just painted the rooms to justify renovation, and they changed the advertised name on the net to avoid the bad reviews !!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & dodgy Hotel but good location”
Reviews.Author: sarzabearz
Reviews.Content: Very close to Paddington station, excellent location, cheap accommodation ok for 1 night or 2 but no longer. Has a kitchen but unable to cook in it as it is filthy, never gets cleaned, mess everywhere. Rooms are tiny, no room to store luggage & unsuitable for 2 people in 1 room. Receptionsist doesn't understand English - very unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “Stinking pit”
Reviews.Author: richbrads
Reviews.Content: Please take my advice and avoid this place! We are no snobs and have travelled abroad before on a budget but this has got to be the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. My poor wife had to get totally drunk before she could face sleeping in there. The rooms are dirty, our bed was full of crumbs and pubes. The furniture is horrible and we had no toilet roll. The staircase carpet is covered in stains and needs a complete makeover. The kitchen was disgusting, piled high with dirty plates with stubbed out fags all over them. I was glad our night was over and we got out as soon as I could. The location was the best part of our stay with plenty of restaurants and bars which are pleasantly lively.

Reviews.Title: “avoid this hotel at all costs.”
Reviews.Author: topbint
Reviews.Content: while i was working in london on the 29th june 2010, me and my colleague stayed in this hotel, the hotel with out a doubt is the worst ive ever visited, i wud not let my dog sleep in this place... the room was dirty, me and my colleauge r coverd in bites from head to toe from either fleas or dirt mites, this hotel is disguisting and i wud never recommend anybody to stay in this place.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this travesty at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: TooltimeNanaimo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have traveled all over the world for four decades. We invariably book budget accommodations so that we can use our finances to enjoy the sites and attractions. During our most recent trip, we visited many cities in England, Ireland and Scotland. Every hotel we booked met or exceeded our expectations both in terms of amenities and location. The Warwick, however, was truly atrocious and we had to move after one night of a planned six night stay. The reception area is, in fact, three desks jammed together in a small area manned by an combination of receptionists and employment counselors (honestly!). I had prepaid for one night, and the receptionists insisted we pay for the rest of the stay up front. When I presented my credit card, she stated she would have to add three percent to our bill. Instead, I paid her all of the cash I had at the time (84 GPB) and then went up to our "room". It was a laughably small room with contained the most decrepit BUNK-BED I had ever seen. It had no towels, no TV, no toiletries, and no area to store anything. The toilet was abysmal and smelled. I immediately returned to reception and met with a different young lady who was most sympathetic and admitted she was anticipating my complaints. She helpfully moved us across the hall to an equally small room, this time with a reasonable double bed, but still no TV or any other amenities. Overnight, she checked around to find us alternate accommodation and was very pleasant. We elected to not take advantage of her findings, and instead went next door to the Tudor Hotel, which was infinitely better, albeit more expensive. Upon returning to the Warwick to collect a refund, we were surprised to learn that they deducted two nights from the cash because, to quote the young lady, "the booking agent on the internet takes the entire first night charge as their fee.". Total rubbish! To put our review into perspective, we have never recommended that fellow travelers avoid any hotel in which we have stayed. This dump is a refuge for young students who can afford nothing else. On the bright side, it is ideally located on Norfolk Square 100 metres from Paddinton Station. There are thirty other budget hotels in the immediate vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Where do we start - absolutley dreadful is a compliment!”
Reviews.Author: KarraCorby
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for our Builders for 2 nights and to be told today that they were appauled by the condition of the hotel is a big disappointment to me. 4 Rooms booked but one room they had to refuse to stay in due to the condition of the room. No Towels, no toilet roll, curtains hanging off the wall, stains on the walls, cobwebs - you name it! This day and age this should not be aloud - they should be shut down, I intend to take this further as we look after our builders and this is not acceptable. Would we recommend to a friend you ask?- we wouldnt recommend to our worst enemy!!! Very very disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “I would try somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 8 nights in this hotel that has a great location from which to get around. We don't have too much positive to say about it although it was reasonably quiet and did have lots of hot water and decent towels. We knew that it was 2 star but expected a little more. The room was tiny and very marked up. The curtains and carpets had not been cleaned (not even vaccuumed) in a very long time (don't look at the top of the baseboards). The bed was very uncomfortable and you could feel every spring. The toilet seat was broken and the light above the sink did not work. (difficult to shave in the semi-dark) The requests for repairs were completely ignored. The bed was obviously tossed together in a hurry each day and the sheets never changed in the 8 days. Not a big deal for us but just to let everyone know what to expect! The breakfast included not very good coffee, (never tried the tea) cold cereal and your choice of croissant or toast. Very tiring after a few days so we decided to try other alternatives. We are not really terribly fussy people and probably could have handled everything without complaint had the management been even a little bit friendly and made you feel like they appreciated your business rather than making you feel like they were doing you a favour.

Reviews.Title: “You wouldn't put your pets here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It certainly doesnt give a good view of London hotels to overseas visitors. We have never stayed anywhere that is so disgustingly dirty in all our lives. We were meeting up with old friends and suggested that they stay at the same hotel - HOW EMBARRASSING - it made us feel sick!!

Reviews.Title: “It's a hovel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Please avoid this place only to be described as a hovel, dirty and disgusting, needs closing down immediatly.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting *****hole!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the warwick hotel we left out luggage and returned later that evening to check in, entered the room and to my disgust I could not believe the standard of cleanliness! Stains everywhere..mould on the carpets ..no stoppers in the sinks..scum everywhere in the bathrooms, i doubt they were even cleaned since the last peeple stayed there..no light bulbs! To say sub standard is an understatement! This property is far below the standards of any hotel..we decided to no let it ruin our wkend and began to unpack only to find beetle/cockroaches in the bathroom/bedroom carpet..we imediately packed up and went dowstairs and asked to be moved..so that is what we did, the next room *an upgrade he referred to it as* I laughed to myself,same story here only no sign of the offending parasites..needless to say we did not stay for breakfast and demanded to check out at 9am after no sleep that night..this establishment is an absolute disgrace..this is only half the story,to be honest I wouldnt let my dog stay in this dirty flee infested "hotel"!they refused a refund, and started shouting at me in french! which of course I understand and asked him did he think I was stupid!...A total ignorant management team ...They dont have a clue about standards..or customer services..stay well clear of this place..choose a hostel over this any day..complete waste of money!You have been warned!

Reviews.Title: “It's not very good”
Reviews.Author: StevePER
Reviews.Content: There are two good things about the Warwick Hotel - the price and the location very close to Paddington station. But having said that, there is heaps more accommodation nearby and it would be worth paying a little extra. The staff are uninspiring, though we had no particular complaints. There are no lifts, so be prepared to carry your luggage up several flights of stairs. The passageways are littered with suitcases of unknown origin. Our room was adequate, but very small. The shower was so small it was difficult to get in and shut the door. A continental breakfast was included in our room rate, but since it's nothing more than juice and all-you-can-eat toast, we gave it a miss after the first morning. Given the abundance of other accommodation in the area, you would do well to give this one a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rate/Comfortable Bed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Warwick offered us excellent and comfortable accommodations at a reasonable price (?42 for a double room with en suite shower and TV) in a GREAT neighborhood in London. Warwick is easy walking distance from the Paddington Station (take the express train from Heathrow for ?15 or take the Piccadilly Line to the Paddington Tube stop). there are five to ten excellentr restaurants nearby, including a couple nice pubs. one can easily access Hyde Park, where I jogged four mornings during our stay.You want luxury? This ain't the place. We slept there, bathed there and ate breakfast there. All met out expectations for sleeping, bathing and dining. Besides, what kind of moron wants to stay in your hotel room when one is in London???

Reviews.Title: “AVOID this place! Esp. single female travelers...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel! I have stayed in several small, budget hotels throughout Europe, so I expected a small room, to have narrow stairways, etc. But this hotel was quite dirty--everything in the room was stained, from the walls to the carpet to the bed linens and mattress--and not just a little bit, it was disgusting. There was a thick layer of dust in the furniture and the cup in the toothbrush holder in the bathroom was caked with paste. Even the tiny soap bar had dirt on it. The soap dish was coming off the wall, the curtain could not be opened and was black and stained, and the walls were paper thing. Most disturbing, the staff insisted on cash payments for rooms even though a sign clearly says they accept credit cards. They were not friendly at all, there is no clear reservation system, and the hallways are littered with luggage--the same bags for days, you have to walk over some to get to the rooms. This place was disgusting, it did not feel safe at all, and I was very uncomfortable. Better to spend a few pounds more on a decent room anywhere else, a room that is not filthy in a place that does not make you nervous. Friends stayed here as well while I was there, and we all had the same experience with the rooms and staff. One woman in particular was called by the front desk staff when she was obviously alone in her room, apparently he wanted to check up on her! (scary!) On another day, when she returned to her room, she found cigarrette butts on her bathroom floor. What is going on in this place, we all wondered. Stay away from this hotel! There are other options, same location, that seem much better.

Reviews.Title: “When lodging is not your priority, this hotel will do.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When I booked a hotel on-line for my recent trip to London, I was mostly concerned with location and price. This was my first trip to London and with lots to do and see in the city, I knew beforehand that I would be spending very little time in the hotel room. The hotel is one of the many small hotels that are in the two buildings that line the square near Paddington Station. For price and location, the hotel met my expectations. However, if you prefer to not "rough it", this hotel is not for you. There is no lift in the hotel and I had to carry my heavy luggage up a narrow stairway to the 6th floor. The room was extremely small but clean. Furnishings were equal to that of a dormitory in that the room was not fancy nor comfortable. The attached bathroom smelled as if the sewer system vented directly into the room. Despite these things, I was little bothered. I was mostly irratated with the lack of "pleasantness" with hotel staff (all from countries outside the U.K.) and surprised to find that they appeared to have little concern that my stay at their hotel would be a pleasant one. The hotel does serve a continental breakfast each morning on the lower level that consists of toast, cereal, coffee and juices. I would stay at this hotel again, if I was seeking price and location. However, there are other hotels on the square that offer the same ...and they have a lift!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at a very reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Warwick was just exactly what I thought an English Hotel should be. Very clean, quaint. The Warwick was within a short walk of everything I wanted to see. The neighborhood was great! On Sunday morning I was awakened by the Queen's Horse Guard exercising the horses. Atmosphere galore. Food in the Pimlico Room was much better than what I expected English food to be.

HotelInfo.Name: So Paddington
HotelInfo.Address: 6 - 8 Norfolk Square, London W2 1RS, England (Formerly Warwick Hotel)
